messages.subject: stressed out
messages.msgSnippet: Dawn F. wrote: Why, if you you do something you love for a living, is it stressful... Stess ... Stress and enjoyment are not mutually exclusive. Lots of things
messages.messageBody:
Dawn F. wrote:
Why, if you you do something you love for a living, is it stressful... Stess
>comes from doing things we don't want to do in life. <SNIP>

Stress and enjoyment are not mutually exclusive. Lots of things people like
are stressful. After a long day, with kids arguing and laundry all over,
being a homemaker is stressful (to ME). That's not to say I don't love it.
My job is quite stressful at times, though I like it. I just don't want more
stress at home than I have. That's why my income-earning occupation takes
place away from my home.

And since you asked, i think the definition you gave earlier was to the word
"righteous." Self-righteous means "filled with or showing a conviction of
being morally superior or more righteous than others; smugly virtuous."

Annette
